intro: Beyeria lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf beyeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Beyeria lanceolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
